item.title: Man arrested after stolen truck crashed at GAA club
item.description: A man in his 30s is due in court in Dublin next month in connection with the theft of a truck which was driven into a GAA grounds during nursery and juvenile training sessions last weekend.
item.source:markdown: A man in his 30s is due in court in Dublin next month in connection with the theft of a truck which was driven into a GAA grounds during nursery and juvenile training sessions last weekend.

item.title: Donohoe 'disappointed' at Bank of Ireland staff comments
item.description: The Minister for Finance has said he is "disappointed" following reports that some Bank of Ireland staff made "disparaging comments" related to the tracker mortgage scandal.
item.source:markdown: The Minister for Finance has said he is "disappointed" following reports that some Bank of Ireland staff made "disparaging comments" related to the tracker mortgage scandal.

item.title: Sudan war: Women endure starvation, rape and bombs fleeing El Fasher
item.description: In war-torn Sudan, rape is likely being used as a weapon of war and simply being a woman there is “a strong predictor” of hunger, violence and death, the UN’s gender equality agency warned on Tuesday.
item.source:markdown: In war-torn Sudan, rape is likely being used as a weapon of war and simply being a woman there is “a strong predictor” of hunger, violence and death, the UN’s gender equality agency warned on Tuesday.

item.title: Trapped behind bars: Reforming Haiti’s broken detention system
item.description: Fifty-two prisoners have died in Haiti’s overcrowded prisons between July and September this year in conditions that have been described by the United Nations as “inhuman and degrading.”
item.source:markdown: Fifty-two prisoners have died in Haiti’s overcrowded prisons between July and September this year in conditions that have been described by the United Nations as “inhuman and degrading.”

item.title: Stakes rise for South Sudan: What’s happening, and why it matters
item.description: South Sudan is entering a period of rising instability marked by political polarisation, renewed armed clashes, and severe humanitarian strain, senior UN officials told the Security Council on Tuesday.
item.source:markdown: South Sudan is entering a period of rising instability marked by political polarisation, renewed armed clashes, and severe humanitarian strain, senior UN officials told the Security Council on Tuesday.

item.title: Keeping cool on a hotter planet: COP30 pushes for sustainable cooling and AI innovation
item.description: As the planet heats up, so does the race for smarter, cleaner technology. At COP30 in Belém, Brazil, delegates are weighing a paradox at the heart of climate innovation: how to harness powerful tools like artificial intelligence (AI) and advanced cooling systems without deepening the very crisis they aim to solve.
item.source:markdown: As the planet heats up, so does the race for smarter, cleaner technology. At COP30 in Belém, Brazil, delegates are weighing a paradox at the heart of climate innovation: how to harness powerful tools like artificial intelligence (AI) and advanced cooling systems without deepening the very crisis they aim to solve.

item.title: International Criminal Court: Sanctions threaten global fight against impunity
item.description: Coercion and sanctions against the International Criminal Court (ICC) are “assaults on the very principles of international law itself,” the President of the UN General Assembly warned on Tuesday.
item.source:markdown: Coercion and sanctions against the International Criminal Court (ICC) are “assaults on the very principles of international law itself,” the President of the UN General Assembly warned on Tuesday.

item.title: World News in Brief: Refugee boat tragedy in Andaman Sea, Gaza vaccinations, farmers’ lending scheme
item.description: At least 21 Rohingya refugees, including two teenage girls, have died after a boat carrying up to 70 people capsized in the Andaman Sea off the coasts of Malaysia and Thailand, according to UN agencies.
item.source:markdown: At least 21 Rohingya refugees, including two teenage girls, have died after a boat carrying up to 70 people capsized in the Andaman Sea off the coasts of Malaysia and Thailand, according to UN agencies.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa: Relief efforts intensify as damage across Caribbean grows
item.description: Two weeks after Hurricane Melissa tore through the Caribbean, governments and aid agencies are still struggling to reach communities left without homes, healthcare and basic services, as damage assessments in Cuba, Jamaica and Haiti continue to rise, the UN said on Tuesday.
item.source:markdown: Two weeks after Hurricane Melissa tore through the Caribbean, governments and aid agencies are still struggling to reach communities left without homes, healthcare and basic services, as damage assessments in Cuba, Jamaica and Haiti continue to rise, the UN said on Tuesday.

item.title: Tanzania: Reports of hundreds killed and detained following deadly election violence
item.description: Hundreds of protesters and others have been killed and an unknown number injured or detained in Tanzania following protests surrounding last month’s elections, according to reports obtained by the UN human rights office (OHCHR).
item.source:markdown: Hundreds of protesters and others have been killed and an unknown number injured or detained in Tanzania following protests surrounding last month’s elections, according to reports obtained by the UN human rights office (OHCHR).

item.title: Religious sisters stand with flood-affected coastal communities in Indonesia
item.description:
Even after seeing tidal floods destroy homes and livelihoods, Sr. Vincentia Sabarina, HK, and those around her continue to assist residents of the Indonesian coastal village of Sidodadi.

item.title: Thuggery will not be tolerated, says Garda Commissioner
item.description: The Garda Commissioner has said An Garda Síochána will not tolerate thuggery such as occurred during sustained and significant violence at Citywest last month.

item.title: Thuggery will not be tolerated, Garda Commissioner says
item.description: Garda Commissioner Justin Kelly has said there has been "significant" investment in protective equipment, training and vehicles for members, "particularly since the Dublin riots" in November 2023.

item.title: Smartphone use driving surge in addiction, says expert
item.description: The Head of Addiction Services at St John of God Hospital has warned that shopping, video gaming and gambling are part of a surge in behavioural addiction in Ireland, and that the problem is "all predicated on the smartphone".
item.source:markdown: The Head of Addiction Services at St John of God Hospital has warned that shopping, video gaming and gambling are part of a surge in behavioural addiction in Ireland, and that the problem is "all predicated on the smartphone".

item.title: Cork farm trialling new techniques to cut emissions
item.description: On a windswept Cork farm, hi-tech cow collars track animal health and solar panels glint on the milking parlour's roof, as Ireland tries to reduce its agricultural carbon footprint.

item.title: US Senate passes bill to end government shutdown
item.description: The US Senate has approved a compromise that would end the longest government shutdown in US history, breaking a weeks-long stalemate that has disrupted food benefits for millions and left hundreds of thousands of federal workers unpaid.

item.title: Suicide bomber attacks outside Islamabad court, killing 12: Pakistan’s interior minister
item.description: Pakistan’s interior minister says a suicide bomber detonated his explosives near a police vehicle outside the gate of a district court in the capital, Islamabad, on Tuesday, killing 12 people and wounding 27.
item.source:markdown:

Pakistan’s interior minister says a suicide bomber detonated his explosives near a police vehicle outside the gate of a district court in the capital, Islamabad, on Tuesday, killing 12 people and wounding 27.

item.title: Thailand halts implementation of ceasefire with Cambodia
item.description: Thailand's government has confirmed it will halt the implementation of an enhanced ceasefire agreement with Cambodia, signed last month in the presence of US President Donald Trump.
item.source:markdown: Thailand's government has confirmed it will halt the implementation of an enhanced ceasefire agreement with Cambodia, signed last month in the presence of US President Donald Trump.

item.title: 2 dead after small plane on hurricane relief mission to Jamaica crashes in Florida neighbourhood
item.description: A small turboprop plane on a hurricane relief mission to Jamaica crashed Monday morning into a pond in a gated residential neighbourhood of the Fort Lauderdale suburb of Coral Springs, killing two people shortly after takeoff and narrowly missing homes, authorities and a local resident said.
item.source:markdown:
![Two red emergency trucks are parked inside a gated community. ](https://i.cbc.ca/ais/ab08584a-4a28-4571-953b-ee980f6af5d3,1762849695291/full/max/0/default.jpg?im=Crop%2Crect%3D%280%2C123%2C5754%2C3236%29%3BResize%3D%28620%29)
A small turboprop plane on a hurricane relief mission to Jamaica crashed Monday morning into a pond in a gated residential neighbourhood of the Fort Lauderdale suburb of Coral Springs, killing two people shortly after takeoff and narrowly missing homes, authorities and a local resident said.
